newsitem.title: FRANCE: INTERVIEW - Next 2,3 years key for Saab.
newsitem.headline: INTERVIEW - Next 2,3 years key for Saab.

text.p: The next two to three years will decide the future of Swedish carmaker Saab Automobile, Saab CEO Robert Hendry told Reuters in an interview on Monday.

"My mandate from GM and Investor on being named CEO of Saab Automobile was of course to turn the company into a profitable one. The number of years was not qualified, but GM will not be patient forever. In the next two, three years we must turn Saab Automobile around," Hendry said.
He added that GM expects every brand within the company to stand on its own feet and Saab Automobile was no exception.

Hendry said he had worked previously in joint ventures and experienced problems but Saab Automobile's 50-50 joint owners Investor and GM clearly share the same objectives -- "that is to further the long term value in the Saab brand name".

"GM's Jack Smith has said that if the Saab brand name is developed right, its value will last 20-30-40 years. But we have to get profitable and create our own capital and our own models," Hendry said.
"Every company must face the possibility of not making it, but at Saab we aim to reach sales of 150,000 cars a year by the year 2000. That will make sure we make a healthy profit," he said.
